title: Jubilee Lake
text:
Jubilee Lake is a man-made lake in the <a href="Umatilla%20National%20Forest">Umatilla National Forest</a> in the northern corner of <a href="Union%20County%2C%20Oregon">Union County</a> in the <a href="United%20States">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>. It is located north of <a href="Elgin%2C%20Oregon">Elgin</a> and about south of the <a href="Washington%20%28state%29">Washington</a> border, at an elevation of . Its basin spans Union, <a href="Umatilla%20County%2C%20Oregon">Umatilla</a>, and <a href="Wallowa%20County%2C%20Oregon">Wallowa</a> counties. The lake was made for recreation in 1968 when an earthen dam, long and high, was constructed on <a href="Motett%20Creek">Motett Creek</a>. A <a href="U.S.%20Forest%20Service">U.S. Forest Service</a> campground at the lake has 53 sites and is the most heavily used campground in the Umatilla National Forest. Fishing and swimming are the most popular activities at the lake. A trail around the shore was designated a <a href="National%20Recreation%20Trail">National Recreation Trail</a> in 1981.
Jubilee Lake is considered <a href="Trophic%20state%20index%23Mesotrophic">mesotrophic</a>, with an intermediate level of biological activity, and its drainage basin receives about of precipitation annually. <a href="Rainbow%20trout">Rainbow trout</a> are stocked in the lake for anglers, and youth fishing event is held at the lake each year.
